title: Stewart to retire following 2016 season
text:
Stewart to retire following 2016 season 
By wbng sports Stewart to retire following 2016 season September 30, 2015 Updated Sep 30, 2015 at 6:31 PM EDT 
(WBNG Binghamton) Tony Stewart has more Sprint Cup wins at Watkins Glen International than any other NASCAR driver, but he'll only have one more chance to add to that total, as he made it official on Wednesday announcing he'll retire following the 2016 Sprint Cup season. 
His five victories at WGI are the most by any driver in NASCAR, but Stewart has only raced there once in the last three years. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
In 2013 it was a leg injury that kept him out, while in 2014 he did not race after being involved in the accident that killed Kevin Ward Junior in Canandaigua. 
On Tuesday, he was asked if those situations had anything to do with his decision to hang it up. 
"My leg feels fine, there's nothing wrong with my leg," said Stewart. "The tragedy, nothing is going to change that. It happened, but it's not going to direct the rest of my life. So I'm still going to go race when I want to go race, but as far as the cup series it had no bearing on that." 
It was also announced that Clint Bowyer will take over for Stewart in the No. 14 car starting in 2017.
